description: Common code violations and inspection callouts for Colorado HVAC work

items.common_cause: Not accounting for high altitude (reduced air density)
items.prevention: Calculate required air openings per code, add 10% for altitude above 5,000 ft
items.inspection_notes: Inspectors will measure openings and verify against BTU input

items.violation: Combustion air openings obstructed or terminated incorrectly
items.common_cause: Homeowner modifications, landscaping changes
items.prevention: Document air intake locations, educate customer on maintaining clearances
items.inspection_notes: Must terminate to outdoors or to spaces per code requirements

items.violation: Missing or undersized makeup air for exhaust fans
items.common_cause: Not accounting for kitchen exhaust, bath fans when sizing combustion air
items.prevention: Total all exhaust CFM and provide adequate makeup air
items.inspection_notes: Required when exhaust exceeds supply by certain thresholds

items.common_cause: Not maintaining required clearances from windows, doors, property lines
items.prevention: Verify all clearances per manufacturer and code before installation
items.inspection_notes: Inspectors measure clearances to openings, mechanical air intakes, property lines

items.violation: Incorrect vent pipe material or sizing
items.common_cause: Using wrong category vent pipe, undersized vent
items.prevention: Match vent category to appliance, use manufacturer vent sizing tables
items.inspection_notes: Must be listed for appliance type and temperature rating

items.violation: Excessive vent length or too many elbows
items.common_cause: Exceeding maximum equivalent length per manufacturer
items.prevention: Calculate equivalent length including elbows, stay within limits
items.inspection_notes: Manufacturer's installation manual governs

items.common_cause: Horizontal vents not sloped 1/4 inch per foot minimum toward appliance
items.prevention: Use level to verify proper slope during installation
items.inspection_notes: Condensate must drain back to appliance or approved drain

items.violation: Insufficient working space in front of equipment
items.common_cause: Equipment installed in tight spaces without considering service access
items.prevention: Maintain 30-inch minimum (some jurisdictions require 36 inches)
items.inspection_notes: Measured from front of service access panel to obstruction

items.common_cause: Attic or crawl space equipment without code-compliant access
items.prevention: Minimum 22x30 inch opening required, larger for equipment removal
items.inspection_notes: Must be able to remove and replace equipment through access

items.common_cause: Installing equipment closer to wood than manufacturer allows
items.prevention: Check listing label and installation manual for required clearances
items.inspection_notes: Inspectors verify clearances match equipment label

items.common_cause: Not accounting for total BTU load or pipe length
items.prevention: Calculate using longest length method, include all appliances
items.inspection_notes: Inspector may request pressure drop test or sizing calculations

items.common_cause: Using unapproved materials or fittings (e.g., compression fittings)
items.prevention: Use only approved materials: black steel, CSST (if allowed), brass fittings
items.inspection_notes: Galvanized not allowed for gas in most jurisdictions

items.violation: Missing or improper sediment trap (drip leg)
items.common_cause: Omitting drip leg or installing downstream of appliance valve
items.prevention: Install drip leg upstream of appliance valve, minimum 3 inches deep
items.inspection_notes: Required for all gas appliances

items.common_cause: Spans too long, improper hanger spacing
items.prevention: Support horizontal pipe every 6 feet minimum
items.inspection_notes: CSST requires support per manufacturer specifications

items.common_cause: Missing mastic or tape on duct joints
items.prevention: Seal all joints and seams with mastic or UL 181 tape
items.inspection_notes: Some jurisdictions require duct leakage testing

items.violation: Return air pathway through unconditioned space
items.common_cause: Using building cavities in unconditioned areas for return air
items.prevention: Use listed ducting in all unconditioned spaces (attics, crawls)
items.inspection_notes: No panned floor joists or stud bays in unconditioned areas

items.common_cause: Not meeting R-value requirements in unconditioned spaces
items.prevention: R-8 minimum for supply ducts in attics, R-6 for return
items.inspection_notes: Energy code compliance verification

items.common_cause: Draining onto roof, near foundation, or into planters
items.prevention: Terminate to approved location per local codes
items.inspection_notes: Cannot create slip/fall hazard or structural damage risk

items.violation: Missing auxiliary drain pan or overflow switch
items.common_cause: Horizontal units in attics without secondary protection
items.prevention: Install drain pan with separate drain line, or overflow safety switch
items.inspection_notes: Required for units above ceiling or in areas where overflow causes damage

items.common_cause: Trap missing, improper size, or not primed
items.prevention: Install trap per manufacturer, prime before startup
items.inspection_notes: Negative pressure systems require trap to prevent air leakage

items.common_cause: No visible disconnect within sight of equipment
items.prevention: Install lockable disconnect within sight and reach of equipment
items.inspection_notes: Must be within sight and within 50 feet

items.violation: Improper wiring methods or wire sizing
items.common_cause: Undersized wire for load, improper conduit/cable type
items.prevention: Follow equipment minimum circuit ampacity, use proper wiring method
items.inspection_notes: Outdoor wiring must be in conduit or rated cable

items.common_cause: Equipment not properly bonded to ground
items.prevention: Ensure green/bare ground wire connected to equipment ground lug
items.inspection_notes: Grounding is life safety issue - strictly enforced

items.common_cause: Exposed suction line without insulation
items.prevention: Insulate suction line to prevent condensation
items.inspection_notes: Especially important in humid climates or attic installations

items.common_cause: Long unsupported runs, improper penetrations
items.prevention: Support per manufacturer, protect through penetrations
items.inspection_notes: Avoid vibration and abrasion damage

items.common_cause: Omitting restraints in seismic zones
items.prevention: Install seismic restraints per manufacturer and local requirements
items.inspection_notes: Required in designated seismic areas - check local jurisdiction

inspection_tips: Have equipment manuals on site for inspector reference
Ensure work area is clean and accessible
Test all safety devices before inspection
Document all calculations (load calcs, duct sizing, gas pipe sizing)
Take photos of work before concealment in case of questions later
Know your jurisdiction's specific requirements - they vary
